intro: Pterospermum subsessile, commonly known as the slender pterospermum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by indehiscent capsules containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it a notable species in tropical and subtropical flora, often found in moist, shaded environments.
